intro: Boehmeria conica, commonly known as the silky flax or Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures. Boehmeria conica produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine.
